questions.question_text:
A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Finance.

You implement a risk rating for vendors. The risk rating is on the Vendor form.

The rating is determined by a vendor's on-time delivery performance as well as their credit rating.

The risk rating consists of the following values:

1 = Good
2 = Medium
3 = Risky

The company plans to implement purchase requisitions. The company wants to prevent purchase orders from being confirmed when a vendor's risk rating is set to Risky.

You need to implement the functionality.

What should you do?

choices.A: Create a method for the OnModified event of the vendor account.
choices.C: Create a method for the OnInitializing event of the form.
choices.D: Create a Chain of Command (CoC) class extension.

comments.content: No, its for the wrong field...

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B
B is the correct answer. You cannot order by an index and the request is to select all the records so, no D but B.

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance developer.

You have a table named FMVehicle that contains a field named VehicleId. The table has an index named VehicleIdIdx on the VehicleId field. You declare a table buffer named vehicle to refer to the table.

You need to select all records from the FMVehicle table in ascending order based on VehicleId field in the vehicle variable.

Which embedded-SQL statement should you use?

choices.D: select vehicleId from vehicle order by vehicleId asc;
choices.C: select vehicle order by vehicleIdIdx asc;
choices.A: select vehicle order by VehicleIdIdx desc;

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Finance.

You are performing a code review for several segments of code that use the Boolean data type.

You need to validate the segments for the correct X++ structure.

Which two code statements will compile? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
AD is correct.
In X++, boolean data type is true or false, not 1 and 0.

comments.content:
You are right, thanks for your comment.
According: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/dev-ref/xpp-data-primitive#boolean

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A company uses Dynamics 365 Finance.

You must use QueryBuilder classes to implement a query that loops through all customers for whom the customer group equals EXT. You need to implement the query. You declare and initialize a query object.

You need to run the query.

In which order should you perform the actions? To answer, move all actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Can't be B bcs VehicleId is ID not an index

Selected Answer: D
Correct
The statement uses the index name VehicleIdIdx

Selected Answer: B
VehicleIdIdx is redundant

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance developer.

You have a table named FMVehicle that contains a field named VehicleId. The table has an index named VehicleIdIdx on the VehicleId field. You declare a table buffer named vehicle to refer to the table.

You need to select all records from the FMVehicle table in ascending order based on VehicleId field in the vehicle variable.

Which embedded-SQL statement should you use?

choices.A: select vehicle order by VehicleIdIdx desc;
choices.C: select vehicle order by VehicleId desc;
